Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Oddly \Odd"ly\, adv. 1. In an odd manner; unevenly. [R.] [1913 Webster]
2. In a peculiar manner; strangely; queerly; curiously. ``A figure a little more oddly turned.'' --Locke. [1913 Webster]
A great black substance, . . . very oddly shaped. --Swift. [1913 Webster]
3. (Math.) In a manner measured by an odd number. [1913 Webster]

oddly adv 1: in a manner differing from the usual or expected; "had a curiously husky voice"; "he's behaving rather peculiarly" [syn: {curiously}, {peculiarly}] 2: in a strange manner; "a queerly inscribed sheet of paper"; "he acted kind of funny" [syn: {queerly}, {strangely}, {funnily}, {funny}]
